#851

MS next game is gonna be a Baten Kaitos spiritual sequel (Saga to Chronicles) and instead of the sky its gonna be underwater. I don't know a lot of japanese so I wont come up with a name but it will have Baten in it. No card mechanic, that's your action game.

#869

You think Nintendo cares about that? Paying another company to make a sequel to with such a small fanbase? This isn’t a Bayonetta situation where it brings something to Nintendo that they don’t have.

They are his games though. If Nintendo is at all involved, which seems reasonable given that their copyright is listed on the game page, it seems likely that he would have some involvement as well.

That said, people are making a big assumption about him moving back to Tokyo, when it could have nothing to do with game dev. Or his position at Kyoto was always intended to be temporary.

Also worth noting that he was heavily involved in the original Xenosaga, and did concept work for Xenoblade. If the brain trust has been working out where to head next with the Xeno series, I could imagine him having some significant involvement.

Yeah I think someone brought that up a while ago, but maybe it was just a general set of jobs.

We don't have the graphics section yet, so if Monolith devs aren't on UI, then it still makes another title likely. At the very least, some of the Xenoblade leads have been up to something else since last year and potentially as far back as 2020.

Of course that doesn't disprove the existence of an action game.

#872

So TotK credits are partially out and there's good news and bad news.

The bad news is that this is the "action game" that Andrzej Zamoyski was working on. Well it's great for him lol. Hiroshi Ando worked on it too.

The good news is that none of the absent staff I mentioned in the Future Redeemed post are here except for maybe Shigekazu Yamada and Mamoru Ohta, as the full credits haven't been posted on Kyoto Report yet.

Did Honne show up anywhere? He’s the big mystery with respect to “what Monolith Soft might do next” right now.

Slightly disappointed Zamoyski seems to have been working on TOTK all along, but I always figured that was a possibility. In hindsight, his previous experience being level design probably should have tipped us off.

EDIT: So apparently Honne is credited under “Special Thanks” for TOTK, which is interesting. IIRC he doesn’t show up in XC3’s credits at all, so while it’s possible he’s just running Monolith Tokyo’s PG2, this also means he hasn’t had a full credit since like… Xenoblade 2 or thereabouts? That’s quite a while to not have been doing any non-Special Thanks stuff. We’ll see if he shows up in the credits for the Baten Kaitos remasters.

#879

Yeah, Kojima and Mamoru Ohta not working on Future Redeemed/ along with Genki Yokota not directing on the EPD side means that something else from PG1 has been in the works since at least last year. That isn't surprising, but Yamada not being credited since DE in 2020 is another oddity.

We know that Xenoblade 3 started pre-production after 2 and then entered full production as soon as Torna was finished. The difference is that Kojima/Yokota/etc. stayed on. It makes me wonder how far along the next PG1 game is.
